title.narrative: Abating Mercury Emissions via Mobile Processing Units for Small-Scale Gold Processing in Suriname

description.narrative: To improve the livelihoods, health, and environment of artisanal and small-scale gold miners in Suriname through the introduction of newer, more profitable gold processing techniques which are easily adoptable and adaptable to unique challenges at each location.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Conservation of the Mid-18th-Century Elisabeth Samson Mansion in Paramaribo

description.narrative: Built in 1742 for Elisabeth Samson, a successful businesswoman and the first black female millionaire in the Americas, the house is one of the oldest buildings in Suriname. This project involves the restoration of the building for eventual reuse by the Elisabeth Samson Museum and the Museum of Labor.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs
Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

description.narrative: Better Police Readiness in Caribbean Assistance awards made through Bilateral Agreements, Letters of Agreement, including those established under C-175 authority, and Fulbright Commission agreements. The obligation of funds does not constitute a bulk obligation where funds will later be sub-obligated through other instruments.

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

title.narrative: Restoration of the 18th-Century Commander's Residence at Fort New Amsterdam Historic Site

description.narrative: To support the restoration of the 18th-century commanders residence at the Fort New Amsterdam Historic Site, a rare authentic remnant of Dutch mercantile and military dominance in the 17th and 18th centuries in the Western Hemisphere. This project addresses serious deterioration of decorative and structural elements of the building, and it includes the restoration of the interior to its original configuration after centuries of alteration.

participating-org.narrative: SOFNA (Fort New Amsterdam Open Air Museum Trust)

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

receiver-org.narrative: SOFNA (Fort New Amsterdam Open Air Museum Trust)
